<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr. Enterprise Support Engineer, Corporate Systems Team

Location: Nashville Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
At CoreTrust, our mission is to be the one place for all indirect purchasing needs. We envision a prosperous world connected by seamless digital trade and we value building connections, acting nimbly, pioneering exploration, demonstrating fortitude, and driving impact.
To support our rapid growth, we’re seeking a seasoned and proactive Senior Enterprise Support Engineer.
Reporting to the Principal Enterprise Applications Engineer, you will be a pivotal member of our Corporate Systems Team. You will coordinate and resolve complex information system issues and play a crucial role in enhancing overall system performance through strategic problem- solving and continuous improvement initiatives. Your focus will be delivering systematic troubleshooting, communicating solutions effectively to stakeholders, and utilizing insights gained from issue resolution to recommend and implement advancements in our system infrastructure. In this role, adaptability and a commitment to staying at the forefront of technology trends and help desk methodologies are paramount.
ResponsibilitiesCoordinate the prompt troubleshooting and resolution of information system issues through detailed investigationsConduct thorough research to understand technology problems and deliver effective solutionsCommunicate with users impacted by system issues, providing timely updates and supportEnsure follow-up with users after issue resolution for confirmation and feedbackLeverage helpdesk tracking software for system monitoring, and recommend enhancements for user systemsManage onboarding processes to integrate new users into the system efficientlyAim for rapid and effective response times to address user requests and concernsRedirect unresolved issues to appropriate technical or service personnel as requiredMaintain current knowledge of helpdesk best practices and system subject matterImplement and manage system policies to uphold data security and comply with regulationsManage the deployment of system updates and security patches to ensure system integrityAssess and propose enhancements to IT infrastructure for improved performance and efficiencyCollaborate with various departments to align technology solutions with business goals
QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management Systems, or related field or equivalent work experience6+ years of work experience in a helpdesk or user support roleDeep understanding of helpdesk operations and user support excellence.Strong analytical skills for prioritizing and resolving technical issues efficiently.Proficient with helpdesk tracking software and system analysis tools.Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear user interactions.Skilled in managing and configuring Microsoft 365 applications and services.Proven leadership in mentoring junior staff towards team success.Highly detail-oriented with exceptional organizational capabilities
BenefitsCompetitive compensation package Free individual employee medical coverage Company subsidized dental and vision coverage Dollar for dollar 401(k) match up to 6% of your salary with immediate vesting Company-paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability coverage Employee Assistance Program to support your wellbeing and mental health $1500 annual stipend for undergraduate/graduate college courses; $500 annual stipend for continuing education courses/certifications Free snacks and beverages on-siteBrand new, state-of-the-art, tech-enabled work environment in downtown NashvilleFlexible/hybrid work culture

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
